name: UPSC IES/ESE (Engineering Services Exam)
description: The Engineering Services Examination (ESE), also commonly known as IES, is a national-level competitive examination conducted by the UPSC for recruitment to various engineering posts in the Government of India. The exam is conducted for four engineering disciplines: Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, and Electronics & Telecommunication.

eligibility.ageLimit: 21 to 30 years as on 1st January of the examination year. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (SC/ST, OBC, etc.) as per government norms.
eligibility.educationalQualification: A degree in Engineering from a recognized university or equivalent. Candidates must have a degree in one of the four disciplines: Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal/Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came to India before January 1, 1962.
eligibility.numberOfAttempts: Unlimited, subject to the age limit criteria.

timeline.examDate: Preliminary Exam: February 18, 2024; Main Exam: June 23, 2024
timeline.resultDate: Results for each stage are declared a few months after the exam. Final result is typically declared in November/December.

examPattern.mode: Offline (OMR-based for Prelims, Pen-and-Paper for Mains), and in-person Interview.

stages.name: Stage 1: Preliminary Examination (Objective)
stages.description: Consists of two objective papers. Paper-I (General Studies and Engineering Aptitude - 200 marks) is common for all candidates. Paper-II (500 marks) is on the specific Engineering Discipline. Total: 500 Marks.

stages.name: Stage 2: Main Examination (Conventional/Descriptive)
stages.description: Consists of two conventional (descriptive) papers in the specific Engineering Discipline. Each paper is for 300 marks. Total: 600 Marks. Only those who qualify Prelims can appear for Mains.

stages.name: Stage 3: Personality Test (Interview)
stages.description: An interview and personality test for candidates who qualify the Main Examination. It carries a maximum of 200 marks.

examPattern.markingScheme: For the objective papers in Stage-I (Prelims), there is a penalty of 1/3rd of the marks assigned for each wrong answer. There is no negative marking for the conventional papers in Stage-II (Mains). The final merit list is prepared based on the marks obtained in Stage-I + Stage-II + Stage-III (Total 1300 Marks).

syllabus.name: Preliminary Exam - Paper I (Common)
syllabus.topics: General Studies and Engineering Aptitude: Current affairs, Engineering Aptitude (Logical reasoning & Analytical ability), Engineering Mathematics, General Principles of Design, Standards and Quality, Energy and Environment, Project Management, Basics of Material Science, ICT, Ethics and Values in the Engineering profession.

syllabus.name: Preliminary & Main Exam - Paper II (Discipline Specific)
syllabus.topics: In-depth syllabus based on the candidate's chosen engineering discipline: Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering.
